Character Summaries

Butterflies are Free - May 28-June 6

Don Baker (M) early-mid-20s, and should be able to sing
Jill Tanner (F) early-20s, a flighty hippie.
Mrs. Baker (F) 50s, Don’s mother, an attractive and well dressed woman
Ralph Austin (M) 30s or so, director, somewhat arrogant

Funny Money - June 18-June 27

Henry Perkins (M)an insignificant middle-aged middle-class accountant
Jean Perkins (F)his pretty wife
Vic Johnson (M)a friend of the Perkinses'
Betty Johnson (F)Vic's wife, also pretty
Bill (M)a London taxi driver
Davenport (M)a bent copper
Slater (M)a straight copper
Mr. Big (M)aka Mr Brerfcurse
A passer-by

The World Goes 'Round (musical) - July 9-July 18

Man 120-50 yrs old Range: A4 - G5 A bit of a ham
Man 220-50 yrs old Range: G3 - A5Stern and demanding with a commanding voice.
Woman 120-50 yrs old Range: E3 - A5Tough and strong. A bit of a lush and snob.
Woman 220-50 yrs old Range: F3 - G5Independent. Zany. She is seductive.
Woman 320-50 yrs old Range: F3 - F5Nostalgic. Adventurous. Hopeful.

It Could Be Any One Of Us - July 30-Aug 8

Mortimer Chalke (M)a red-face, fiery frustrated musician composer in his mid-fifties. He plays the piano with great concentration and passion.
Jocelyn Polegate (F)A rather wispy writer, Mortimer's sister; late forties a well-meaning but flighty mystery writer who started to write 34 books but has never managed to actually finish a single one of them.
Brinton Chalke (M)A pale, lean, twitchy, staring-eyed, high-strung painter, Mortimer's brother; early forties, idiosyncratic with a blend of childlike passion, physical humor, middle aged gloom, emotion and quirkiness.
Amy Polegate (F)Jocelyn's sixteen year old, "kind of dumpy" daughter full of teenage boredom, resentment and attitude.
Norris Honeywell (M)A kind of sad, mournful looking insurance salesman in his mid-forties who wants to be a private detective. He makes Inspector Clouseau look like Sherlock Holmes.
Wendy Windwood (F)A cozy, pleasant, rather shy "middle-aged mum" with a great smile and impeccable comic timing.
Note that all roles require a British dialect.

Be My Baby - August 20-August 29

Gloria Nance (F)Early twenties, ingenue, naive, in-love
Maud Kinch (F)Mid fifties English woman, opinionated, quick wit, sharp tongue, nose in the air
John Campbell (M)Fifties, Scottish, cheap, crude, cheap, loud, opinionated
Christy McCall (M)Twenties, Scottish, wealthy, eager
Male EnsembleTwenties, plays a variety of roles
Female EnsembleTwenties, plays a variety of roles

Fox On The Fairway - Sept 10-Sept 19

Justin (M)superb golfer but hates bad news
Louise (F)Justin’s fiancée
Bingham (M)Country club manager
Pamela (F)country club booster (for Bingham) with a racy personal life
Dickie (M)Country club manager, in rivalry with Bingham and ex-husband to Pamela
Muriel (F)strong-willed wife of Bingham who owns an antique shop
